name: Sheraton on the Falls

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel IS THE BEST! We have stayed at many Sheraton's over the years and this is the hands down winner. The front desk people are extremely friendly and knowledgable. They go above and beyond. Check in is always fast and friendly. We're members of the Starwood perferred guest program and we ALWAYS receive a comp. upgrade. Our last visit we were upgraded from a room with no view to a king mini suite with sitting area, view of the Falls (spectacular!) fireplace, mini balcony AND jacuzzi (there's a TV and phone in the bathroom)
reviews.title: You'll Love this Hotel and Staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Rooms are clean and contemporary. This hotel is located within steps to all Falls attractions. There is a covered walkway to the Casino, so leave your coat in the room and go. The restaurant's food in excellent and fresh although a bit pricey (but that's standard for Sheraton) If you go to the Falls, do yourself a favour and stay here, I've been going to Niagara Falls for over 20 years and this is my hotel of choice. I really can't say enough good things about this Sheraton. They really do make you feel like you are a valued guest and they genuinely care about you.
reviews.title: Loved the view!

likes.disliked: — Not enough time to stay there

reviews.text: Service was exceptional. Everywhere we went there was staff waiting to assist us. The room was clean, neat and comfortable. The view was wonderful. The only problem I had was that I was unable to utilize all the amenities offered since I only stayed one night. I intend to return to take full advantage of all this hotel has to offer.
reviews.title: Family fun

reviews.text: We took a one-night family vacation to Niagara Falls with my one-year-old daughter, husband, and teenage sisters. We were lucky enough to check in early, so we dropped off my husband and daughter first and my sisters and I went across the border for some shopping! My husband and daughter had a great time, as this hotel is connected to a number of attractions. They had a great lunch at the Raintree cafe (very cool fish tanks and animals!) and went on the ferris wheel. They had dinner at the buffet restaurant with a view of the falls. It was absolutely worth it to book a room with a view of the falls, but the dinner and breakfast package was not worth it (very expensive restaurant- recommend eating elsewhere in Niagara Falls, unless you don't have a room with a view- it is the view that makes the restaurant worth the cost!). Breakfast was over $100 and we only had a $27 credit for breakfast with our package.
reviews.title: Good service, good hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We'll stay at this hotel again (debated staying at the Sheraton Fallsview, but picked the Sheraton-on-the-falls for its location next to Clifton Hill). Next time we'll book the waterpark package!
reviews.title: Outstanding Staff & Amenities

reviews.text: Satyed Oct 2004 with my Girlfriend for 2 nights, on a twin centre trip incluing Toronto.
reviews.title: Pretty Good Hotel
great hotel
reviews.text: Very clean rooms and lovely pillows.
Had a good view of the American Falls from our 4th floor room, which had a fireplace in it!
reviews.title: We Loved It!

reviews.text: Great location - just opposite the falls and nice walk to Canadian falls.
reviews.title: Not too impressed!

reviews.text: Only downside were the pools - we were not sure if they were open or not, but went in anyway, but they were really cold and did not stay too long!
reviews.title: Sheraton on the Falls - TERRIBLE

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed at the Sheraton on the Falls on the long weekend for our wedding anniversary. We had terrible customer service and problems at check in, problems with parking and above all our room was dirty. There was hair in the bathtub and stuck to the tiles in the shower. There was some sort of brown liquid splattered on the wall under the window (looked like blood...gross)
reviews.title: Never Again
Completely overrated
reviews.text: For a hotel that claims to have a 4 diamond rating, we were less than impressed.

We have stayed in Sheraton hotels more than once and this one is completely overrated. We paid an outrageous price for one night during Memorial Day Week end. Needless to say, our room had a view... on the roof and the air conditioning machines. The room was TINY. Most bulbs were out of order, we had to call service twice for the problem to be fixed. The toilet was flushing in a strange and noisy way, we mentioned it but it was not fixed when we left. I felt I should have taken a chance and gone to a hotel outside Niagara Falls. I can't believe the price I paid for this room, compared to many other hotels we went to.
reviews.title: Nice hotel, great location.

reviews.text: I traveled to Niagara Falls for a three day girl's getaway. We booked a City View room and were very pleased. We received a room on the top floor and our window overlooked the back of the hotel so not magnificent but it was right for the price. The room was large and spacious and in good order. Everything was clean and well-maintained. The beds were very comfortable.
reviews.title: Excellent location and fabulous views

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I really liked that there was complimentary internet access in the lobby for hotel guests. It was nice not having to bring a laptop along to check my e-mail.
reviews.title: Only stay if you are in falls view room

reviews.text: We stayed here for two nights in July, 2001. We were only going to spend one night, but liked it so much, we cancelled our 2nd night elsewhere and just stayed! We had a large, lovely room which overlooked the falls on the 10th floor. It had a nice fridge/microwave and a t.v. that worked! The lobby is like something out of "Gone With The Wind", with its winding staircase and there is also a baby grand piano! (I think marble floors also). Even enough elevators for such a large hotel! AND! Free internet service in the bar area! The front desk staff could not have been more attentive to our requests and even gave us a breakfast buffet included in our second night's rate! We managed to have a table beside a large window overlooking the falls and what a way to eat a wonderful, hot breakfast! The only problem? The 2nd night, our a/c did not work and it was HOT, HOT that July! All in all, it was a positive experience and if we return there, we will definitely stay there!
reviews.title: Wonderful Visit

reviews.text: We did a winter trip to Niagara Falls and got a good rate of $169 CAD for an upper floor view of the Falls. The view is great, the hotel is very well kept and is well located surrounded by restaurants and a Casino.
reviews.title: Beautiful View in the Offseason
Horrible
reviews.text: The only problem was the parking garage, which is not attached to the hotel. You have to pay $8 CAD per day for your stay and walk outside to get to the garage.

reviews.title: Great value
reviews.text: We requested a NON SMOKING room and we got that but the smoke from the other rooms was coming into our lower level bathroom through the vent. It was horrible. When we called and made reservations, they told us there was NO FEE for the wireless connection for internet service, they told us as we tried to connect that it was 15.00 a day to have the internet in our room. Picture and discription on the internet says free champagne, there was none, only WATER to drink. When we got there the hotel had NO WATER, about 45 mins after we checked in we had water. The next morning we awoke to , yep you guessed it, NO WATER AGAIN!!!! They knew the city of niagra was having problems all WEEK with not having water and not ONCE mentioned it to us as we were checking in or as we booked the room by phone. Our down stairs TV did not work, we called on it and they DID not send a person up to even look at it. Each time we wanted to go from the lobby to our room, we had to take the elevator, and each time it was at least a 20-30 min wait in line to get to our room. The only too good things about this hotel were, a clean room and a great view of the falls. Housekeeping also came into our room EVERY time we left our room for whatever reason, we know this because there was always more coffee and sugar packets in our room when we came back, now I really see NO reason for them to be in our room that many times in a day...only when you ask them to come. My recomendation?? If you dont want to shower or make coffee , if you dont want to watch tv and dont mind waiting in line forever to return to your room??? Stay here , if not, RUN AWAY FROM THIS HOTEL!!!!!!!! They wouldnt even return any of our money to us.

reviews.title: Good times for all, great staff. Stay here its great
reviews.text: The Sheraton is pretty much everything you would want in a hotel in Niagara Falls. Right next door to Clifton, and conveniently attached to the Rainforest Cafe, and the Hard Rock, which leads to the (older) Casino. We were on the sixth floor and had a great view of the falls, which at night were absolutely spectacular! The room was spacious, and very clean. Our standard room even had a fireplace and seating area that added to the room's overall appeal. The staff were all extremely pleasant and were very anxious to help and even went out of their way a few times to provide more than we asked for. The room service was adequate, what you would expect from a large chain hotel. The price of room service seemed to be in line with what you would have paid for similar fare on Clifton street. A little travel tip: speak to the concierge on your way out the door, double check on your directions for the attractions you are about to see. They often have discount coupons tucked in their drawer; They might only be for a couple dollars, but every cent counts!

reviews.title: Pay to Upgrade
reviews.text: It was at the Sheraton On The Falls that I had an out of body experience. As we were discussing with the concierge the dangerous piece of metal that was sticking out of the bedstead in our bedroom, an impeccably dressed young lady approached the concierge’s desk. His eyes fixed on her and we could no longer be seen or heard.

reviews.title: Wonderful Hotel
reviews.text: The Sheraton On The Falls is a place for those who travel light. The doors of our very narrow wardrobe were wedged against a bed. It was easier not to unpack.

reviews.title: Worst place we've ever been!
reviews.text: The bedroom and corridor décor could be described as shabby chic or shabby beige depending on your mood after attempting to use the wardrobe or banging your leg on a lump of metal.

reviews.title: Fantastic views
reviews.text: Our tiny bathroom sported huge mirrors planned perhaps to make the room look bigger but possibly unnerving for a man who has to face himself when using the toilet.

We could have the indoor swimming pool entirely to ourselves. This may be because there are no changing rooms. Guests look in, read the signs that say visitors should not wear outside apparel, look around for a private place to change and store their belongings then leave bemused.
reviews.title: What a view!

reviews.text: I am currently sitting in a conference hall at this Hotel. The air conditioner is not working and the conference room is about 30 degrees C (90 F). My experience has not been good. To summarize, On the first night my room AC was not working and had to be repaired (which was done quickly.) My assistant had booked an upgraded Falls View room with whirlpool and balcony. I have included a picture of the balcony which was literally 1 foot wide and 22 stories high. The view of the main falls was non-existent but I could see a portion of the American side of the falls (the smaller ones). The bulk of my view was the metal roof of the hotel (see photo). There were cigarette butts on the "balcony" of my non-smoking room and multiple spiders/webs. The whirlpool hot tub was a standard (small) tub with jets and the side panel partially falling off. The service was acceptable but as a business traveler I needed dry cleaning and was told on Saturday that I would not get my clothes back until Wednesday because it was a long weekend. Also, the business center closed at 5 so I had to have the front desk print and fax documents for me. I would not stay here again.
reviews.title: Adequate Service, Terrible Hotel

reviews.text: I Must admit, its hard to believe the great reviews for this hotel. I suppose it all depends on what your looking for. I came here for a conference for 5 days. The rooms are clean, the view is fantastic, its close to all the tacky tourist attractions (ie. Wax museum, Riplie's Belive it, Haunted Houses...yes, weird).
reviews.title: Great view, awfull hotel.
EXCELLENT CHOICE!!!
reviews.text: The problem is that the hotel isnt cheap and it is filled with "secret charges." For one, there is a Starbuck's in the lobby,m however the price of Coffee is twice a normal starbucks and for some reason, the coffee is AWFULL, many people noticed this, watered down coffee..The room is filled with tourist trap stuff that costs a fortune, more so than other hotels. There is a fitness room, but what they fail to tell you is it costs 10.00 a day to use! there is wireless internet, 15.00 a day and it is just awfull, unreliable, slow, very very bad. Dont even look at the swimming pool. Yuck.

reviews.title: Good location, worth the money I paid
reviews.text: This is not a hotel if you want internet, business, a conference or fitness. And to top it all off, wait till you see the situation with the elevators. Only some go to the top 12 floors but yet, you have no choice which elevator stops. Its just really odd and hard to explain.
For parking, its in a building that is shared by other hotels and business, it took me 35 minutes to park. Just awfull.
reviews.title: Great

reviews.text: We reserved the room for three nights and only stayed one. The air vent had mold on it, the air conditioning unit wouldn't turn off, the shower had mold and wouldn't drain and finally, there was broken glass on the floor in the bathroom. We packed up and requested a new room. When we checked the new room, we discovered that the air conditioning/heater wouldn't turn on. We even found a housekeeper and asked her to try to turn it on to no avail.
reviews.title: Reasons to NOT stay here.
This hotel was not worth the money!
reviews.text: We checked out and found other accommodations. The worst part? It was rated four stars!!!

We traveled to Niagara Falls on Friday August 26th and left Monday August 29th. I have been to the Falls before, but, my husband and 9 month old have never been there and we thought this would be a nice long weekend trip. We traveled with my brother-in-law and sister-in-law and my 5 year old nephew and 4 year old niece. When we arrived, we were placed on the 2nd floor. I was quite disappointed as I was told by the reservationist we would be able to see both falls and we were only able to see the American Falls. The stay went from bad to worse. My husband and brother-in-law were sitting on the couch in the one room and the feet on the couch suddenly collapsed and broke. A hotel employee came to fix it pretty quickly and we were compensated $50 for our trouble, but, for the money we were paying for the room, I certainly didn't expect the furniture to fall apart when someone sat on it. Apparently, there is an arcade below the 2nd floor of the hotel and it stays open until 1am. Needless to say, none of us got any sleep that night because of the loud music and noise from the arcade. The pictures on the walls of our room were actually rattling from the noise. Finally, at 12:30am I had enough and went to the front desk to complain. I inquired as to why the hotel would place 2 families with 3 children under the age of 6 right on top of the arcade. There was no explanation given, only a promise to move us the next day to a higher level. I was also given vouchers for breakfast. The next day we were moved to the 16th floor. The rooms were much nicer and we had a view of both falls. However, the room move wasn't without problems. Before we left to do some sight seeing in the morning, I inquired about when the rooms would be ready as my 9 month old would need to take a nap. At 10am that morning, I was told that both rooms were vacant and housekeeping was told to expedite cleaning to get us moved. However, when I returned at 1pm, I was told by another person at the front desk that the rooms were still occupied. When I repeated to her what I was told in the morning regarding the rooms, suddenly, 1 of the rooms was available. Coincidentally, when the rooms were being checked on, I saw a list of "room moves" for the day and there were no less than 5 other rooms from the 2nd floor that were being moved also. Wonder why???? Could it be the noise from the arcade??? So, we finally got our new room and we were told the luggage would be moved right away. Two hours later, I called the front desk and inquired about our luggage. The girl had no idea what I was talking about. It wasn't until I told her that I wanted my luggage brought to my new room that she said someone would be up in 15 minutes with the luggage. After that conversation, I was totally convinced that the employees of the hotel have absolutely no independent thought or initiative in assisting guests of the hotel. That evening was our only restful night at the hotel. The next evening, we were awakened at 3am with the noise of a fire alarm. How pleasant!! The lines for the elevator were always long. We had breakfast in the hotel two mornings. It was overpriced and not worth the money. All in all, I would not recommend this hotel and the next time we travel to Niagara Falls, we will try another hotel.
reviews.title: Disappointed with the Sheraton Great Bed and Good View!

reviews.text: We stayed at the Sheraton on the falls room 666. It had a great view of the American Falls but the Barely could see the Canadian Falls. The reservationist assured me that we'd be able to see the fireworks, but mainly we seen smoke. Could have been the direction of the wind. The pools are very small and my kids ages 13 and 15 passed. There was a thermostat in the room but it didn't matter what I set it on the room was cool, but not as cool as I prefer. There was wierd vents and things on the ceiling that seemed old. The bathroom was VERY small and the hairdryer was broken. The bed was GREAT!!!! The elevators are VERY VERY SLow and there was a line in the afternoon 20 people deep. You would not want to be in that building if thier was a fire, because I didn't even see any signs for stairs. I was told we had a balcony but actually it was a big sliding door with bars about chest high. The food was very expensive, so we walked far away from the hotel ended up at the OUTBACK-thier prices we what I would expect. The Perkins near our hotel was over $50 for breakfast and my two kids shared french toast and me and my husband had a normal breakfast (eggs/pancakes). We ended up eating a meal at the Casino next door they had a food court with fast food chains that offer a limited amount of menu choices--example Kentucky Fried Chicken had Chicken,Fries and Chicken Sandwich--that's it. We went on the Maid of the Mist Boat Ride. That was good, but the behind the falls walk was not worth it. When you're on the boat ride look over to the right of the falls and you'll see stairs and people standing getting soaked on a viewing platform. That's it! and that is all that you really see. Not worth it. There are tunnels that lead to nothing and then the platform. There are 2 Sheratons I think if I go back I would look into the other one, but I would probably stay at the Embassy Suites on the falls--it looks new and they must have a great view of the Canadian falls because they are located even with them. The Sheraton is even with the American Falls, but I was told that if we paid $50 more we'd be able to see the Canadian falls by going one floor up. We had trees from a park blocking the view. All in all we had an okay time and I really did enjoy watching and hearing the American Falls from our room. The TV didn't have hardly any channels and they charge alot for internet access, so thier was nothing else to do since I don't gamble at the casino. Hope this helps.
reviews.title: The Great view is what you get
Great Experience
reviews.text: Stayed at the hotel from Sat. night thru Tues morning. We had a full Falls view room on the 18th floor with Jacuzzi tub & fireplace. Had called two days before to advise that we would be arriving between 4-6 pm. Arrived at that time & as was always the case the lobby was awash with scores of people. Check-in was very efficient & quick. They expained to me that we could valet or self park and the applicable fee for each. The bellman immediately took our bags to our room.

My wife and I visited the Sheraton on the Falls on Aug. 8-11, 2005. I have a Gold membership through Starwood Vacation Club. It's is a great way to travel for free and stay in some of the best hotels around. I used my points for a Superior Falls View room. When we checked in the staff at the counter was very nice and helpful.
reviews.title: Great View, Great Family Resort, Lots of People!!!!
Busy Area
reviews.text: I was suppose to get a Superior Falls Room on the 17th floor or higher and according to the hotel website, and view of the falls. When you check in, you might ask and see what type of view you are going to have. We kinda did get what we had requested but the view was not what we had expected.

I was disappointed on the first room on the 17th floor which was a Superior Room located on the end and in the middle of the building. I though when you walked into the room you would be able to see the falls. We didn't see anything except the buildings towards the other Sheraton. Only when you go to the window and looked to the left could the falls be seen. The room was clean and the bed was comfortable. Our fireplace was clean and worked great. It's all electric. Bathroom had a large whirlpool tub and one sink. The shower was another story. Very, Very Small. If you are a big guy, no way you are going to fit in this shower. Lucky for us we didn't have any problems. Even on the 17th or 19th floor the hot water was quick and good water pressure.
reviews.title: Not worth the money (except for the view)

reviews.text: After we checked in I went back to the desk later that evening and told them I had paid extra points for a view of the Falls and could we be moved to a room that had a front view of the falls, not a problem, they moved us to 19th floor the following morning. We had been up since 4:00 AM to get to the hotel by plane and car so I did not want to move to another room that night anyway, so we stayed in the first room for one night.
reviews.title: THE SHERATON IS A GREAT LOCATION!!

reviews.text: Room on the 19th floor was excellent. Looked just like the picture on their web site. When you open the curtains the falls are right in your face, great view. Best part of the trip. The rest of the room had the same description as above.
reviews.title: Loved Niagara

reviews.text: We booked this hotel for a weekend getaway in Niagara Falls. It is within easy walking distance to the falls and other attactions. The hotel is also connected to the older casio and the Brock Hotel. Our room was on the 4th floor and was considered to have a partial view of the falls and we were pleased that could see all of the American Falls. The view of the Horseshoe (Canadian) Falls was blocked by trees. On Friday night there were fireworks and we had a great view of them. The room itself was spacious with an electric fireplace that almost looked real. We did have one problem, my wife noticed that the shower curtain liner was soiled. We called the service desk and even though it was after 8:00 pm , they sent a maid up within 15 minutes and she changed the liner after she had scrubbed down the entire tub/shower area. We were impressed. One other minor problem was that at certain times of the day the elevators are hard to get. We stood in the hall for 10 minutes or more before one stopped on our floor. They must be aware of this because they had someone in the lobby calling elevators for people. Garage self-parking was a reasonable $10 per day. I would not hesitate to stay there again.
reviews.title: A nice stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I just returned from our vacation in Ontario and a fond memory will be our stay at the Sheraton on the Falls.
reviews.title: Wonderful Stay at Sheraton on the Falls

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff starting with the valets and concierge and certainly the front desk staff were wonderful and helpful. They were great ambassadors for the hotel and for Niagara Falls.
reviews.title: Stay here when visiting niagara falls!!

likes.liked: — Quality service and beautiful room and view
likes.disliked: — Can't think of anything! For the price we paid it was an absolute bargain!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room we had was awe inspiring with the beautiful view of the falls and the city.
reviews.title: Sheraton on the Falls is the best!!
Awesome Sheraton
reviews.text: As a platinum member it has been one of the best stays at SPG hotels I have ever had. There was no club lounge (which most Sheratons have) but that would certainly not affect my decision to return, should I come back to Niagara.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We booked a falls-view room - if you are going to pay for a hotel right ON the Falls, then this is a no-brainer and well-worth the extra $$. We slept with the window open and could hear the rushing water. Rooms were nice enough - cool photos of the falls instead of typical mass-produced hotel artwork. Gas fireplace was an interesting touch.
reviews.title: Nice property - great view

likes.disliked: — Tour-bus mob in restaurant at lunch

reviews.title: Sheraton stands for Service!
reviews.text: Ate in the restaurant for breakfast (buffet - excellent!) and lunch. View from restaurant is fabulous (get a window seat if possible). Stay away from the lunch buffet - they evidently partner with tour agencies to offer the lunch portion of the tour. This huge group (easily 100 people) of people came in all at once and the place was a madhouse. Unlike breakfast, the quality of the food was poor (low-cost high-volume menu). We ordered sandwiches and a salad a la carte and they were fine (large portions).

We are long-time Starwood members and have had the good fortune to stay at some of the finest properties in North America, Latin America and Europe. While hotels vary greatly in decor and amenities, an absolute necessity is that the level of service remain the highest possible.
reviews.title: Deep appreciation for excellent service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: From the moment we pulled into the parking garage at the Sheraton on the Falls in Niagara we were treated as valued guests. Valets were polite and helpful, doormen accommodating and the front desk staff were pleasant and efficient. We had booked three rooms for a large family group and were given three adjacent rooms with wonderful views of both the American and Canadian falls. The rooms were very comfortable and each included a sofa and cozy fireplace. They were clean and well appointed.
reviews.title: Best place to stay in Niagara Falls

likes.liked: — The view and the comfortable beds!

reviews.title: Sheraton on the Falls was Great!
reviews.text: The location was excellent, although since it was freezing (winter, go figure...) we opted for the 5 minute drive to the falls our first day. There was a charge for parking at the hotel, but in-and-out priveledges were included. (If you've spent any time in New York you will appreciate that.) There is also a significant tourist area and a Hard Rock next door if you are into that. There are plenty of options for children including an indoor (rooftop!) water park nearby.

Stayed @ Sheraton On The Falls In early May 2010 (over Mother's Day). We were treated excellent from the moment we stepped out of the car. Which after driving 12 hours to get there was a welcome change. Everone was exceptional on staff. Our bellman, Audie was fantastic & unloaded a very full truck & vehicle storage rack (along w/my parents crates of oxygen & oxygen concentrators) This was no small feat. He did all of this with 3 bell carts by himself @ the end of his shift with a smile on his face & no complaints. The front desk was extremely helpful too as we had wheelchairs & scooters awaiting us. Our rooms were absolutely phenomenal & we paid for the Premium view & it is well worth it. We had the most amazing view of both the American & Canadian Falls every night & day. That is why I selected this hotel & it was definitely the right selection. The rooms are very spacious even with a scooter parked in the two queen rooms, there was still plenty of room to move about and use the seating areas without difficulty. Everything is immaculate & the staff is the best. My only suggestion is to not partake in the dining card promotion @ the Rainbow Room next door. The dining @ the Sheraton is fine & we enjoyed dinner there. But they give you a dining card to use next door @ the Crowne Plaza. Dinner was not worth it despite the great view. You will not regret staying here but definitely do the view it's so worth it. BTW, if you are coming from the US side, this hotel is just over the border & is very acessible from the bridge, so you will love it's ease & convenience after a long drive into Niagara. Also the hotel is literally across the street from Maid of the Mist tours & connected to everything in the area. You are in the heart of the tourist district - you couldn't ask to be more in the center of it all but still be tucked away in your own private heaven! :0)
reviews.title: Treated like Royalty

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the Sheraton on the Falls for 3 nights...had a room on the 20th floor with a great view of both falls. Service and staff was excellent! Everyone was so friendly and pleasant and helpful! The traps: parking is $15 per day for self park, the taxes on every purchase really adds up surprisingly. Also I would say that their room service menu is very very limited and a bit disappointing. The breakfast buffett was great - had tons of things to choose from with omelette station and waffle station. Had dinner at the Crown Plaza - it was just ok. Buffett dinner at Sheraton also good. The Sheraton is a great location - in the middle of it all. We were there for our 1 yr anniversary and we had a great time and it exceeded our expectations!
reviews.title: Excellent Stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I have stayed in many "fallsview" hotels in Niagara. This hotel, by far, has the best view of the falls and the lower river. We also had the luck to upgrade to the 2 story Presidential Suite. It was our second time to be able to stay in 1 of these rooms. Oppulence abounds in these rooms. Any time I can upgrade to this, I will...
reviews.title: exceptional stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I recently returned from a weekend getaway to Niagara falls and our wonderful stay at the Shearton on the Falls. The Shearton on the Falls was truly within one block from the American Falls it was so easy to walk there. As far as the accomodations that room was amazing and room service was outstanding!! The hotel restraunt could be updated a little more as far as menu options, but overall service was good.
reviews.title: Location Wonderful & Service Great

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The view of both the American and Horseshoe falls is breathtaking. The floor to ceiling windows allow a spectacular view. My boyfriend and I never imagined that we would end up spending at least a half an hour a day hanging out of our window on the 19th floor. Each night was spent with the window open, welcoming the soothing white noise of the Falls. The weather was on our side, considering it was the end of April, with daytime highs of 78 degrees! It was sunny and beautiful!
reviews.title: A View from the Top

reviews.text: I have stayed here 6 times in the last year and every time was better than the last. The quality of service is something that is hard to find in the US> the staff are always willing to help and the guest services dept. is amazing. Oh and lets not forget the breathtaking views from your falls view room. not to worry about the winter months all the rooms have a fireplace so leave the door to the falls open and enjoy the sounds of the falls. Well I have another trip planned for November see you there. Dont go cheap and get a city view cause you might as well stay at the travelodge. Keep in mind you are going to niagara falls and with a room that faces the city isnt that interesting, spend the extra 100 or two and get a falls view. one more thing breakfast is expensive here but well worth it. give it a try you wont find a place in Canada that has a better view
reviews.title: Awsome Service
Has lots of bad reviews, but we didn't have any problems
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed at the Sheraton on the Falls from 9/26/05 to 10/1/05. Since we were on our honeymoon we splurged on a corner suite. We didn't have any problems at all while we were there. Our room was clean and fresh and available as soon as we arrived (about 6:30 pm). Since we told the clerk checking us in that it was our honeymoon, he moved us up to the 21st floor. We had a great view of everything including the Canadian Falls. We kept the windows open at night and didn't hear anything but the falls.

reviews.title: Avoid this Place!
reviews.text: My only complaints about the hotel are minor. One night we decided to go to the Penthouse restaurant for an early dinner. We called to make sure the buffet was open and we were told it was. However, when we got downstairs, we were told the buffet was closed until dinner (45 minutes away). When we checked in to the hotel, we were told that our receipt that we would get the last night of our stay would show a $0 balance so we could get the GST back. It didn't, but all we had to do was stop at the front desk on the way out.

Basically, like with all hotels, you get what you pay for. If you don't want to pay much for a room, you won't get very much. I'm pretty sure this is the only hotel with a front view of the falls. All of the other hotels looked like you would be looking from the back of the falls. We would stay here again, but would probably go for the next room rate down from the corner suite.
reviews.title: Not a 4 star by any means

reviews.text: Never got a wink of sleep all night. Hotel is right next to all the noisy attractions of Clifton Hill. Loud rock music until 1a.m. No sound proofing at this place whatsoever. I complained and asked for my money back and all I got were bonus Sheraton reward points! Hotel gets a lot of conventions and children often roam the halls screaming and yelling at all hours. Much too noisy for a pleasant stay.
reviews.title: Overpriced, poorly run motel in a nice location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband & I went to Niagara Falls for a few days to celebrate my birthday. We stayed at the Sheraton on the Falls and had a wonderful holiday. The staff were fantastic from the moment we entered the hotel. We were greeted immediately by a very nice staff member in the parking lot that directed us to the hotel and gave directions on where to park. The front desk staff were also very nice and extremely helpful. Upon checkin the staff at the desk gave me a lovely little gift to celebrate my birthday and a card. A very nice touch for such a large hotel.

reviews.title: Disappointed in the Sheraton on the Falls
reviews.text: from Burlington, Ontario

reviews.title: Watch out for "traditional room"
reviews.text: This was our first experience staying at the Sheraton on the Falls and it will probably be our last. The price of the stay was way overpriced. First of all do not buy the package deal because believe me, it is not worth the money. Although, the view was lovely, the food was not worth the money. We had purchased the one evening dinner voucher with the two breakfasts.

The first evening we had dinner the room had a disgusting odour!. It smelt as though the linen had been washed in fish water. It was so bad that I could not even finish my meal, which by the way was not worth what I paid for. My husband had the buffet, which at $32.95 should have included some decent food. The "penne" which resemble a mushy lasagna was horrible and if that is considered to be award winnng then my grandmother rest her soul would have rolled over in her italian grave. The next day we went for breakfast and the smell was somewhat gone, but again, the buffet was way overpriced and so was everything else on the menu. Charging $8.95 for a child's buffet was highway robbery especially if you have a family with a few children. I don't know about other families, but I certainly know that my two young children don't eat much and to charge them that is a crime. And don't expect to get much sympathy if you ask the waiter/waitress to allow you to share or split a meal from the regular menu, which I did the next morning with my one son, who by the way is autistic and doesn't eat much. The waitress may never come by your table again to refill your coffee cup. The food voucher is a greedy means of getting you into their restaurant only to take advantage of you once there. Also, if you do have children, don't expect to get a table by the window to view the falls, even when there are empty tables available. They just won't sit you there. They will make up some story about a group coming or some other lame excuse. Oh no, they will sit you as far away from the window and as far away from the main buffet as possible. I guess those noisy children don't deserve to sit by the lovely window to view the falls. Afterall, they are only children. I just want others to be very careful when booking these overly priced hotels that offer these meal deals. Be very careful and don't expect to get much for your money. Although I could not check off the "Terrible" box I also have some reservations checking off the "Okay" box because it really wasn't OK.

reviews.text: First the good...Good location unless you would rather avoid the Clifton Hill area. The American Falls and the lovely landscaped park area are across the street. You can walk to the Maid of the Mist, casino is next door and there are shops all around. The lobby, is nicely decorated but very busy. Starbucks is downstairs. The staff is very good. They handled my complaint very well. The beds are very comfortable. In the end I was not sorry I stayed there.
reviews.title: We loved it!!
We loved this hotel!
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed at Sheraton on the Falls in early February. I read a lot of hotel reviews trying to choose the right hotel. We could not have been happier with our choice. The location of this hotel is excellent - walking distance to both falls yet in the middle of the tourist district close to all the attractions and restaurants. Our room was on the 17th floor - awesome view of the falls. The hotel is in great shape, rooms are clean and modern. The bed was super comfortable with lots of pillows. We had a tub and a stand-up shower. There was even a small tv in the bathroom! What impressed us the most was the hotel's stuff - excellent and quick service, very friendly and professional. Our second day there we decided to order breakfast to be delivered to our room when we realized that we were out of the order forms as we have already used it the night before. Not a big deal, we called the front desk and asked for another one. Not only were they there a minute later, they were so apologetic about it, they offered as a choice of $15 off our breakfast or a 2 pm checkout the next morning. Great overall experience. Will definitely recommend it, well worth the money spent!
What a VIEW..... We were put on the 21st Floor, we had booked a corner suite as it was our wedding anniversary and we can honestly say this was the best room in the hotel.

reviews.text: We went over the American side at $6.00. Good views from this side.

reviews.title: Had a BLAST
reviews.text: We booked a New Year's Eve package for the Sheraton on the Falls and Falls View Waterpark and had an amazing time. The hotel was wonderful and the staff was extremely gracious and accommodating. The hotel allowed us an early check-in and late check out. The room was clean and room service was extremely fast. The view of the falls was incredible, especially the fireworks. Added bonuses, the hotel is connected to the waterpark, an arcade, a casino, Hard Rock Cafe and several other restaurants, delis, etc., and just outside is Clifton Hill. A perfect location.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I highly recommend Niagara Falls in Winter! See the Falls in a spectacular way with giant icicles and frozen mist. Truly gorgeous. Low crowds and lots to do- especially if you have kids. Sheraton is in great area but I would recommend the Brock which is adjoining. Sheraton is under construction so we were disturbed every morning by jack hammers which continued through the day. we called in advance to make sure the construction was over- they said yes- but it was not.The room was not the cleanest- although the staff were super nice. I wish they had new blankets and towels as they were pretty nasty, and we are not that picky but it really needed to be cleaned. The hotels have Starbuck's in the lobby- Rainforest cafe'. Hard Rock, Planet Hollywood, an incredible arcade (even has bumper cars) and an indoor waterpark not to be believed. Adults would love the waterpark too for its upper deck which allows you to see your kids while you relax. It is kept at summer temps. and has a bar!! We don't have kids and we even loved it.We walked through the Brock and it looked beautiful.
reviews.title: Niagara in Winter A++
Great place to stay.
reviews.text: Street level has a Hershey's and Coca-Cola shops- and a million other things to do. Oh yeah- i forgot about the Casino adjoining as well- pleasantly surprised at how big it was and nice!! If you have a car- a drive to "Niagara on the lake" is well worth it. Beautiful drive there and cute town to walk through with cute shops and eateries.

aka: Sheraton On The Falls Hotel Niagara Falls
description: The AAA/CAA 4-Diamond Sheraton on the Falls hotel offers the largest, most luxurious Fallsview accommodations in Niagara Falls, Canada. Located directly across from Niagara Falls and in the heart of the tourist district, the hotel features the best views of the Falls which are showcased by the floor to ceiling windows in all Fallsview rooms & suites. Sheraton is also home to outstanding guest services & amenities which include two new fallsview dining experiences; the 4-Diamond award winning Windows by Jamie Kennedy and the new Fallsview Restaurant. In addition, the hotel offers the breathtaking new Christienne Fallsview Spa, and indoor connections to the attractions, dining, and entertainment located on the 20 acre Falls Avenue Resort including Casino Niagara, and the Fallsview Indoor Waterpark.
